pyarcade.gamedb module¶

show-inheritance

class pyarcade.gamedb.GameDB(**kwargs)[source]¶

game class that represents the model to create a game resource. Primarily represents a game and its save state

Parameters

  • id (int) – primary key that uniquely identifies a save

  • player_id (int) – key that uniquely identifies a user and is associated with this save

  • save_name (str) – name of the save

  • save (BLOB) – game object being saved

class pyarcade.input_system.InputSystem[source]¶

Class that handles input for all games

get_current_game()[source]¶

getter for current game

Returns

return current game which could be any of the games in pyarcade

Return type

game

handle_blackjack_input(user_input: str) → str[source]¶

This Accesses the blackjack game and runs blackjack logic based on user input and returns result for start.py to print out. This function acts as a handler that calls the functions associated with blackjack to allow the player to progress in the game or execute game specific menu options chosen and then returns the output.

Parameters

user_input – input from user varying from menu options to game options such as hit or stand

Returns

returns current state of user and house hands

Return type

String

static handle_card(user_card: str)[source]¶

Finds a corresponding card based on user input and returns that card of type card. If none exist it returns None :param user_card: string representation of Users card played :type user_card: str

Returns

card with rank and suit specified None

Return type

Card

handle_crazy_eights_input(card_input: str) → str[source]¶
Handles input varying from game menu options such as help, save, clear and game options such as draw

Accesses the crazy eights game and runs crazy eights logic based on user input and returns result for

start.py to print out

Parameters

card_input (str) –

Returns

returns what the last card played was in the form of a string

Return type

String

handle_game_input(game_name: str, user_input: str)[source]¶

Handles input given game name (mastermind, minesweeper, crazy eights, blackjack, etc) and user input and returns the correct output based on which game and the option that is selected.

Parameters

  • game_name (str) – name of the game to check input against

  • user_input (str) – user input representing which choice from main menu options is chosen

Returns:

handle_mastermind_input(guess_input)[source]¶

Accesses the mastermind game and runs mastermind logic based on user input and returns result for start.py to print out.This function acts as a handler that calls the functions associated with the mastermind to allow the player to progress in the game or execute game specific menu options chosen and then returns the output.

Parameters

guess_input (str) – input that decides which menu option to take or guess to evaluate

Returns

A sequence of integers to be guessed by the player.

Return type

hidden_sequence List[int]

handle_minesweeper_input(location_input: str)[source]¶

Accesses the minesweeper game and runs minesweeper logic based on user input and returns result for start.py to print out.This function acts as a handler that calls the functions associated with minesweeper to allow the player to progress in the game or execute game specific menu options chosen and then returns the output.

Parameters

location_input (str) – location of desired move represented as a string or menu option depending on format

Returns

a string representation of the minesweeper board

Return type

board_str (str)

save_game(game_object, save_name: str, user_id: int)[source]¶

Saves a game object through pickling

Parameters

  • game_object (BLOB) – game object to be pickled and saved in database

  • save_name (str) – name of the save for later reference

  • user_id (int) – unique identifier associated with user

Returns

None

save_game_by_username(game_object, save_name, username)[source]¶

saves a game and associates it with a given username, this takes the place of userid

Parameters

  • game_object (BLOB) – game object to be pickled and saved in database

  • save_name (str) – name of the save for later reference

  • username (str) – username to be associated with game save

Returns

None

pyarcade.start module¶

show-inheritance

pyarcade.start.run_pyarcade()[source]¶

Method used to start the pyarcade. Logic of navigating the pyarcade and starting selected games as well as output of choices are encapsulated in this method

Returns

output of current state of pyarcade ex: menus, game outputs, etc

Return type

String
